KKR and Bain each bid more than $5 bln for Seven | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Private equity firms KKR and Bain Capital have each made bids exceeding $5 billion for non-core assets of Japan's Seven & i Holdings. The bidding marks a significant move in the retail landscape as Seven & i seeks to divest from various subsidiaries.

  • KKR's bid is approximately 800 billion yen ($5.1 billion) for York Holdings.
  • Bain Capital's offer stands around 1.2 trillion yen.
  • Japan Industrial Partners has also placed a bid of around 750 billion yen.
  • The bids surpass the expected enterprise value of 500 billion yen set by Seven & i.
  • Seven & i aims to finalize the winning bid by February 2024, with significant implications for the company's future.
“The largest privatisation of a Japanese firm, if realised, would mark a historic development in the market,” according to sources.

This bidding round indicates the companies' strategic focus on streamlining operations and responding to competitive pressures in the retail sector.
newTitle: KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO listing: Is strong market debut on cards? Check GMP - India Today
summary:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO: Is Strong Market Debut on Cards?

Published On: Dec 25, 2024

Source: India Today

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO has garnered significant attention, being subscribed 81.88 times by the end of Day 3 on December 23, 2024, indicating strong investor interest ahead of its market debut on December 27, 2024.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed with the retail investor segment at 26.8 times, QIB at 166.33 times, and NII at 98.47 times.
  • This is a book-built issue valued at Rs 840.25 crore, comprising an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares.
  • The price band of the IPO is set between Rs 269 and Rs 283 per share, with a minimum investment of Rs 14,999.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) currently stands at Rs 170, suggesting a potential listing price of around Rs 453, equating to a 60.07% gain per share.
  • This IPO is managed by Nuvama Wealth Management Limited and registered with Link Intime India Private Ltd.
"Considering the price band of Rs 283, the estimated listing price for the IPO is around Rs 453, calculated by adding the cap price to the GMP."

The anticipation builds as investors look forward to the strong debut of DAM Capital Advisors on the stock exchange this Friday, further driven by positive market sentiment.
newTitle: DAM Capital Advisors IPO Listing: Anticipating a Strong Market Debut

title: From HNIs to retail, why were gold ETFs investors' favourites in 2024? Will their stellar performance continue in 2025? | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Gold ETFs Surge in Popularity Among Investors in 2024

Publication Date: 2024-11-30 Source: Live Mint

In 2024, gold Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) saw a remarkable increase in demand, quadrupling investments to ₹1,256 crore from November 2023 to November 2024, as a response to geopolitical uncertainties and market volatility.

Key Points

  • Significant growth in gold ETF investments noted, especially among HNIs and retail investors.
  • Factors influencing demand include geopolitical tensions, inflation, and stock market volatility.
  • Experts expect gold ETFs to remain popular into 2025 as uncertainties continue.
  • Discontinuation of the Sovereign Gold Bond Scheme may redirect investment interest toward gold ETFs.
  • Retail investors’ participation rose 76%, despite still holding a small share of 6% in AUM.
“Gold ETFs have witnessed a sharp rise in popularity throughout 2024, with AUM growing 64 per cent year-on-year.” - Mayank Jha

In conclusion, the ongoing global economic conditions are likely to keep gold ETFs attractive for investors in the upcoming year.
newTitle: Gold ETFs Surge in Popularity Among Investors in 2024

title: Toyota global production down for 10th month despite rising sales | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Toyota Global Production Down for 10th Month Despite Rising Sales

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Toyota Motor's global production decreased for the tenth consecutive month in November, despite an increase in worldwide sales driven by strong demand in the U.S. and China.

  • Toyota manufactured 869,230 vehicles globally in November, down 6.2% year-on-year.
  • U.S. output declined by 11.8%, with a slow recovery noted as production for certain SUV models resumed.
  • China's production fell by 1.6%, an improvement over the previous month’s 9% decline.
  • Japan witnessed a 9.3% decrease in output, influenced by a two-day halt at some plants.
  • Worldwide sales rose by 1.7% to 920,569 vehicles, setting a record for November.
  • In the January-to-November period, global output was down 5.2% compared to the previous year.
'Toyota has decided to build an independent plant in Shanghai to manufacture electric cars for its Lexus brand starting in 2027.' – Nikkei

In conclusion, while Toyota faces production challenges, it continues to achieve record sales in a competitive market, signaling resilience amidst adversity.
newTitle: Toyota Global Production Down for 10th Month Despite Rising Sales

title: Tata Capital IPO Date: Tata Group's new IPO in the works - All details - ET Now
summary:
Tata Capital IPO: Details on Tata Group's Upcoming Offering

Updated: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Economic Times

A new IPO from Tata Group is on the horizon, with preparations underway for the Tata Capital IPO expected to launch by mid-2025.

  • Tata Capital, a leading non-banking financial company (NBFC) in India, is poised to initiate its IPO.
  • The Tata Group has begun discussions with bankers for a projected $2 billion IPO.
  • The RBI classifies Tata Capital as an upper-layer NBFC, necessitating a share listing by September 2025.
  • Current market valuation of Tata Capital is around Rs 3.5 lakh crore, with shares trading in the unlisted market.
  • If successful, this will mark Tata Group's second IPO in the last two decades, following Tata Technologies' IPO in 2023.
“Tata Technologies shares were issued at Rs 500 in IPO and made a bumper listing at Rs 1200.”

This IPO could significantly enhance Tata Capital's market presence and expand Tata Group's portfolio in the financial sector.
newTitle: Tata Capital IPO: Details on Tata Group's Upcoming Offering

Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge

Publication Date: N/A

Source: Bloomberg

Lyft Inc. has filed a lawsuit against the city of San Francisco, claiming it has been overcharged $100 million in taxes over five years due to misclassification of driver compensation.

  • Lyft argues that taxes were calculated based on total passenger payments rather than Lyft's revenue model.
  • The company claims this method violates its constitutional rights and misrepresents its financials.
  • The lawsuit highlights ongoing disputes regarding gig economy companies and their classification of workers.
  • Lyft is seeking refunds for overpaid taxes, interest, penalties, and fees.
  • This case follows similar tax disputes with other companies, including Uber.
“Lyft doesn’t take operating in San Francisco for granted and we love serving both riders and drivers in our hometown city,” the company stated.

The outcome of this lawsuit could have implications for how gig economy companies are taxed and classified, potentially affecting future operations in the city.
newTitle: Lyft Accuses San Francisco of $100 Million Tax Overcharge

title: Biryani is a ₹10,000-crore market in Tamil Nadu - The Hindu
summary:
Biryani is a ₹10,000-crore market in Tamil Nadu

Published: December 25, 2024 08:24 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The biryani market in Tamil Nadu boasts a staggering valuation of ₹10,000 crore, with Chennai leading as the largest market. This article explores the dynamics of the organized and unorganized biryani industry and its notable players.

  • The organized biryani market is valued at ₹2,500 crore, while the unorganized market is over ₹7,500 crore.
  • Chennai accounts for 50% of the biryani business in Tamil Nadu.
  • Major brands in the market include Dindigul Thalappakatti, Junior Kuppanna, and Buhari.
  • Chennai's biryani consumption statistics reveal that residents ordered over 46 lakh chicken biryanis in a year.
  • Startups like Cookd are capitalizing on the biryani boom by selling a significant number of biryani kits each month.
“I focus more on quality and we cook biryani every two hours and then serve.” - Abdul Rahim, founder of Mount Road Bilal

The biryani culture in Tamil Nadu signifies not just a food item but a culinary experience, with dishes enjoyed at various price points catering to all consumers.
newTitle: Biryani is a ₹10,000-crore market in Tamil Nadu

title: Stock market holiday: NSE, BSE shut today for trading on account of Christmas 2024 | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Stock Market Holiday: NSE and BSE Closed for Christmas 2024

Publication Date: December 25, 2024 - Source: Live Mint

The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) will be closed today for trading due to Christmas. This marks the last stock market holiday of the year.

On December 25, 2024, no trading or settlement activities will occur in various stock segments, including derivatives and securities lending. Additionally, major global markets in the UK, US, and Europe will also be closed.

  • No trading in stocks, derivatives, or SLB on December 25.
  • Currency and commodity markets will be closed for the entire day.
  • Trading will resume on December 26, 2024.
  • The next holiday is Mahashivratri on February 26, 2025.
The last stock market holiday of the year is on Christmas, allowing for a break in trading activities.

This holiday is significant as it affects trading schedules and investor activities during the festive season.
newTitle: Stock Market Holiday: NSE and BSE Closed for Christmas 2024

title: 65,000% in a year! How long before the penny drops? - The Economic Times
NFRA slaps Rs 2 cr fine on Deloitte Haskins for lapses in ZEEL audit - The Indian Express
summary:
NFRA Slaps Rs 2 Crore Fine on Deloitte Haskins for ZEEL Audit Lapses

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) has imposed a penalty of Rs 2 crore on Deloitte Haskins & Sells for failures during the audit of Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd (ZEEL) for the fiscal years 2018-19 and 2019-20.

  • NFRA fined CA A B Jani Rs 10 lakh and barred him for five years from audit roles.
  • CA Rakesh Sharma was fined Rs 5 lakh and banned for three years.
  • The board did not approve the Rs 200 crore FD guarantee provided to Yes Bank by ZEEL's Chairman.
  • Statutory auditors failed to report significant misrepresentations in financial statements.
“Our examination showed that the auditors were grossly negligent, failed to apply professional skepticism and due diligence...”

This ruling emphasizes the importance of auditor accountability and the need for stringent oversight in financial reporting.
newTitle: NFRA Slaps Rs 2 Crore Fine on Deloitte Haskins for ZEEL Audit Lapses

India's stock exchanges—the BSE and the NSE—are closed on December 25 for trading due to Christmas festivities, aligning with other global markets observing the holiday.

  • The BSE and NSE will also close their segments for commodity derivatives, currency derivatives, and electronic gold receipts.

title: OpenAI’s o3 shows remarkable progress on ARC-AGI, sparking debate on AI reasoning - VentureBeat
summary:
OpenAI’s o3 Shows Remarkable Progress on ARC-AGI, Sparking Debate on AI Reasoning

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: VentureBeat

OpenAI’s latest o3 model has achieved a breakthrough by scoring 75.7% on the challenging ARC-AGI benchmark, with a high-compute configuration reaching 87.5%. However, this achievement does not confirm the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI).

  • o3 demonstrates significant progress in AI reasoning capabilities, showcasing novel task adaptation.
  • The ARC-AGI benchmark tests an AI's ability to solve complex tasks typically challenging for current models.
  • François Chollet describes o3's performance as a qualitative shift in AI capabilities.
  • Despite advancements, o3 still struggles with some simple tasks, highlighting the gap from true AGI.
“You’ll know AGI is here when the exercise of creating tasks that are easy for regular humans but hard for AI becomes simply impossible.” - François Chollet

In conclusion, while o3 represents a significant step forward in AI reasoning, it still falls short of demonstrating AGI capabilities, leading to ongoing discussions about the future of AI development.
newTitle: OpenAI’s o3 Shows Remarkable Progress on ARC-AGI, Sparking Debate on AI Reasoning

title: Oil prices up by 1% in thin pre-holiday trade | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Oil Prices Increase by 1% in Thin Pre-Holiday Trade

Date & Source: December 24, 2023, Reuters

Oil prices rose by over 1% on Tuesday due to a better short-term outlook amid thin trading leading up to the Christmas and Hanukkah holidays.

  • Brent crude futures settled at $73.58, increasing by 1.3%.
  • U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude futures ended at $70.10, up by 1.2%.
  • FGE analysts predict price fluctuations as market activity decreases during this season.
  • There are indications of increased oil demand in the upcoming months.
  • China plans to issue 3 trillion yuan in special treasury bonds to stimulate their economy.
  • The U.S. economic data is mixed, indicating solid footing despite weaker consumer confidence.
“Given how short the paper market is on positioning, any supply disruption could lead to upward spikes in structure,” FGE analysts noted.

In conclusion, with impending holiday trading and supportive economic measures from China, oil prices are expected to see fluctuations but retain some upward momentum.
newTitle: Oil Prices Increase by 1% Ahead of Holidays
